# Task

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".



# Data

clean_column("My Column")

Here is the Julia code to solve this problem:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[- ]", "_") 
end

print(clean_column("My Column"))
```
This function `clean_column` first converts the input string to lower case using the `lowercase` function, then it removes any leading or trailing spaces from the string using the `strip` function. Next, it replaces all occurrences of either a space or hyphen ("-") with an underscore ("_"). 

When you run this code with the input "My Column", the output will be "my_column".
